intro: Haplormosia, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family. These plants are typically found in rocky or coastal environments, where they thrive in well-drained soils. Haplormosia species are characterized by their compact growth habit and showy, often fragrant flowers. They have specialized roots that help them absorb moisture from their harsh habitats. The genus includes several species, each adapted to specific ecological niches across different regions.
